meanings.definition: Of or relating to the region around the North Pole.
meanings.sent1: The explorers bundled up in their warmest clothes for the arctic journey.
meanings.sent2: The arctic weather made it necessary to wear thick jackets and gloves.
meanings.sent3: The penguins threw a party in the arctic, complete with ice sculptures.
meanings.sent4: Her icy stare was as arctic as the frozen tundra.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind in the arctic region chilled them to the bone.

meanings.sent1: The arctic wind cut through their coats like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent2: She shivered in the arctic temperatures despite wearing multiple layers.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream was so cold, it felt arctic on her tongue.
meanings.sent4: His words were as arctic as the frost on the window pane.
meanings.sent5: The arctic blast froze the pond solid, creating a perfect skating rink.

meanings.sent1: The ship sailed through the arctic, surrounded by icebergs.
meanings.sent2: Polar bears are known to roam the arctic in search of food.
meanings.sent3: The fish in the arctic Ocean threw a party to celebrate the new year.
meanings.sent4: The secrets of the arctic whispered through the waves of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the arctic Ocean took his breath away.
